channel.title: DDoSing, Is It Right?
channel.description:
[center][b]Please keep things in this topic serious.[/b][/center]
So I recently have been thinking about DDoSing [not me DDoSing someone, just DDoSing in general], and I have been thinking of all the ups and downs to it. I can DDoS, it's very easy to do, and I've only DDoSed one person, brought AspentX down for good because they started to DDoS my server, brought us down for a few days and now I've lost ranks, so I decided to get back at them by DDoSing. I pretty much packed their so called "DDoS protected VPS" with around 63k packets and I've brought them down for good, completely by accident. I just meant to do the same thing they did to me so they'd ease up on their DDoSing, by the time I stopped DDoSing them, I had already sent about 63-75k packets to their VPS and they've been shut down for good. So I need to do something, but I'm not sure if I can even get a hold of the owner because he shut his site down because of it.
Now I realize that DDoSing is a bad thing to do, I know not to send in the double-digit thousand packets, I will still DDoS if I get DDoSed, but only to protect my server and what I've worked for. But I never meant to put them offline, so I'm coming to you guys to catch your opinions on DDoSing. Well, how would you guys handle situations with DDoSing problems and/or when you are being DDoSed. Also I'd appreciate it if you sent me a quick tutorial on how to prevent DDoSing. But anyways, when they first started to DDoS me, I asked them if they could stop, you guys know the general response to that, "Fuck you and your stupid ass server!" Though they didn't use as well of grammar that I am. It was more like, "fuck u and ur stupid ass serv!" Though I warned them that they wouldn't beat me, I could tell that they were amateurs with DDoSing, and I've done many many tests with DDoSing and got pretty well experienced with it. Also one of the staff on my server can find IP addresses, as can I, and infect them with RATs, I cannot infect people with RATs yet. So I knew they wouldn't beat me or shut me down, so I warned them multiple times, I didn't want to cause serious damage to their VPS, like I did, but they didn't stop.
So, was I right or was I wrong? I mean I gave them a good eight to twelve warnings to cut it out, though they didn't believe me, they asked me to stop after about four days, though I had already explained that I had stopped DDoSing for three days, I only really DDoSed them for about 1.2 hours. And with my DDoSer I can send about 1400 packets in two minutes, so you can do the math if you want to know the exact amount of packets I sent, but I had stopped, and after a week or so when they asked me to stop, that's when I assumed I had already sent too many packets and the server wouldn't come back online. So was DDoSing them back right or wrong?

item.title: DDoSing, Is It Right?
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Whip Mod Whip
item.description:
@Mod_Whip wrote:

it’s illegal in most countries, plus most people on this site probably aren’t smart enough to write a program to do it (tbh probably including myself, i don’t know a whole lot about this area of networking).

Read full topic

item.title: DDoSing, Is It Right?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I’m just teasing

Read full topic

item.title: DDoSing, Is It Right?
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:80, topic:389084”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=484900.msg3554388#msg3554388 date=1301775808]
No, it is not right. It’s not just against the rules here, it is against the LAW in just about every country. Also it is not your only recourse to being attacked yourself, since it is against the law you can gather evidence and get their information and report it to the authorities. Twice in the past I have reported people that attacked my server to the FBI, I don’t know what happens afterwards, but it’s probably not very good.

Also, despite what seems to be popular belief, you cannot use an IP address to ‘infect someone with a RAT’ or anything else. In fact, nothing can be done with an IP address other than to report it to an authority for some type of abuse, or send packets to it. That is all.
[/quote]

I thought you believed in self defence?[/quote]
I’d say self defence in real life is different than self defence over the internet. There were other solutions to the problem other than DDoSing the guy back. In real life, if you’re faced with a situation where you have to defend yourself, there will probably be no other options.

Read full topic

Also it is not your only recourse to being attacked yourself, since it is against the law you can gather evidence and get their information and report it to the authorities. Twice in the past I have reported people that attacked my server to the FBI, I don’t know what happens afterwards, but it’s probably not very good.

Also, despite what seems to be popular belief, you cannot use an IP address to ‘infect someone with a RAT’ or anything else. In fact, nothing can be done with an IP address other than to report it to an authority for some type of abuse, or send packets to it. That is all.[/quote]

I thought you believed in self defence?

item.title: DDoSing, Is It Right?
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:76, topic:389084”][quote author=ytuio9 link=topic=484900.msg3558080#msg3558080 date=1302042292]
Some things I noticed…

“Fuck you and your stupid ass server!” Though they didn’t use as well of grammar that I am.

Grammar???

Also one of the staff on my server can find IP addresses, as can I, and infect them with RATs, I cannot infect people with RATs yet.

I’m sorry, but that sentence made no sense.

that’s when I assumed I had already sent too many packets and the server wouldn’t come back online.

So ermm, let me get this straight… A server gets DDoSed, restarts. The DDoS still affects that server even after it stops?

Also I noticed how people like to jump to conclusions about what a person might do. That is something which cannot be determined at all. Each person is different and will act differently in any given situation. The guy you attacked might have gathered some of his players and started attacking back in retaliation. Similiarly, he might have become scared and stopped attacking you. He might have also called the authorities against you, and so on. The possibilities are limitless.
[/quote]
1st quote: Not saying I used good grammar.

2nd quote: It did.

3rd quote: Depends on how good your DDoSer is, mine will ‘overload’ the memory and make the computer run slower and could ultimately shut down a VPS.[/quote]
The thing is, couldn’t he just restart his VPS?

Also

Also one of the staff on my server can find IP addresses, as can I, [b]and infect them with RATs[/b], [i]I cannot infect people with RATs yet[/i].
Paradox..

Read full topic

Also I noticed how people like to jump to conclusions about what a person might do. That is something which cannot be determined at all. Similiarly, he might have become scared and stopped attacking you. He might have also called the authorities against you, and so on. The possibilities are limitless.[/quote]

item.title: DDoSing, Is It Right?
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

Some things I noticed…

"Fuck you and your stupid ass server!" Though they didn't use as well of grammar that I am.
Grammar????
Also one of the staff on my server can find IP addresses, as can I, and infect them with RATs, I cannot infect people with RATs yet.
I'm sorry, but that sentence made no sense.
that's when I assumed I had already sent too many packets and the server wouldn't come back online.
So ermm, let me get this straight.. A server gets DDoSed, restarts. The DDoS still affects that server even after it stops?

Also I noticed how people like to jump to conclusions about what a person might do. That is something which cannot be determined at all. Each person is different and will act differently in any given situation. The guy you attacked might have gathered some of his players and started attacking back in retaliation. Similiarly, he might have become scared and stopped attacking you. He might have also called the authorities against you, and so on. The possibilities are limitless.

Read full topic

item.title: DDoSing, Is It Right?
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

doesnt really ruin them…just runs up bandwidth, memory…etc etc

en.wikipedia.org

Denial-of-service attack

In computing, a denial-of-service attack (DoS attack) is a cyber-attack in which the perpetrator seeks to make a machine or network resource unavailable to its intended users by temporarily or indefinitely disrupting services of a host connected to the Internet. Denial of service is typically accomplished by flooding the targeted machine or resource with superfluous requests in an attempt to overload systems and prevent some or all legitimate requests from being fulfilled. In a distributed denial...

Read full topic

item.title: DDoSing, Is It Right?
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:65, topic:389084”]Twice in the past I have reported people that attacked my server to the FBI, I don’t know what happens afterwards, but it’s probably not very good.[/quote]For minors they confiscate their computer and put it down as a misdemeanor, and they have to do some odd hours of community service. For more mature people, they confiscate their computer and put them in jail for 3 months to two years. Either way it’s bad.

And I did know it was against the law, what it can do to a computer and such, but I just didn’t think of what the consequences could be, I just did it as a reaction.

Read full topic

item.title: DDoSing, Is It Right?
item.dc:creator: @riku9182 riku9182
item.description:
@riku9182 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:65, topic:389084”]No, it is not right. It’s not just against the rules here, it is against the LAW in just about every country. Also it is not your only recourse to being attacked yourself, since it is against the law you can gather evidence and get their information and report it to the authorities. Twice in the past I have reported people that attacked my server to the FBI, I don’t know what happens afterwards, but it’s probably not very good.

Also, despite what seems to be popular belief, you cannot use an IP address to ‘infect someone with a RAT’ or anything else. In fact, nothing can be done with an IP address other than to report it to an authority for some type of abuse, or send packets to it. That is all.[/quote]
& then he starts bannin’

Read full topic

item.title: DDoSing, Is It Right?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

No, it is not right. It’s not just against the rules here, it is against the LAW in just about every country. Also it is not your only recourse to being attacked yourself, since it is against the law you can gather evidence and get their information and report it to the authorities. Twice in the past I have reported people that attacked my server to the FBI, I don’t know what happens afterwards, but it’s probably not very good.

Also, despite what seems to be popular belief, you cannot use an IP address to ‘infect someone with a RAT’ or anything else. In fact, nothing can be done with an IP address other than to report it to an authority for some type of abuse, or send packets to it. That is all.

Read full topic

item.title: DDoSing, Is It Right?
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“Graham, post:63, topic:389084”]If their server can only handle 11 packets per second (calculated from saying your tool does 1400 packets in 2 minutes) then something must be wrong with it… on Emps-Scape at peak times we usually get 2500 packets per second and the most under normal circumstances (i.e. not during a denial of service attack) has been 5000 packets per second.[/quote]Or it’s just a horrible VPS

[quote=“Graham, post:63, topic:389084”]As for the overall topic, doing a denial of service attack is never right even if you have been a target. It’s a complete pain to deal with on the receiving end (extra bandwidth costs, expensive hardware/hosting, being null routed by the provider, etc), and getting into a denial of service “war” with other people is just a stupid idea.[/quote]I never intentionally meant to get into a war, just wanted to get them back, though now I see what I did was just wrong after destroying everything they worked so long for in a matter of an hour.

Read full topic

item.title: DDoSing, Is It Right?
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

If their server can only handle 11 packets per second (calculated from saying your tool does 1400 packets in 2 minutes) then something must be wrong with it… on Emps-Scape at peak times we usually get 2500 packets per second and the most under normal circumstances (i.e. not during a denial of service attack) has been 5000 packets per second.

As for the overall topic, doing a denial of service attack is never right even if you have been a target. It’s a complete pain to deal with on the receiving end (extra bandwidth costs, expensive hardware/hosting, being null routed by the provider, etc), and getting into a denial of service “war” with other people is just a stupid idea.

Read full topic

And why are you associating my name with something bad?

coon

Insulting term for a black person

Coon = Raccoon
If I wanted to say it resulting to black people, dare I endup muted, but I would say NiggerHunter. Ill be expecting a mute on that.
[/quote]Oh thanks for clearing that up. I used to think “racist twat” whenever I read a post by you :P[/quote]
Never take a title to what you think it means. Without reading the book, your definition can be completely out of context.
